item.title: Connect to the server
item.description: Connect to the Server The IRC Server is available through Clearnet, I2P (disabled currently, will be fixed), Tor and CHAVPN. Please choose one of the darknet methods (that is, not clearnet) if you intend to use the server regularly. Connect from the Clearnet Connect directly (via Chatzilla, etc.): ircs://agora.anarplex.net:14716/#agora. Host: agora.anarplex.net Port: 14716 Connecting requires SSL, the certificate might be expired (which is not a problem unless you sell SSL certificates).

item.title: Register your Nickname
item.description: Register your nickname Many features of the server can only be used with a registered nickname. To register your nickname, follow these two simple steps: Register your nick on irc: /msg nickserv register <password> Replace <password> with a secure password of your choosing. Confirm your nick via our website, Tor: http://y5fmhyqdr6r7ddws.onion/nickconfirm/confirm Clearnet https://anarplex.net/nickconfirm/confirm Failing to register can result in not being able to join certain channels, not have private conversations with certain other users, or not even be able to use any service during times when we raise the defcon.

item.title: Server side ignore
item.description: Server side ignore Due to the problem of spamming on anonymous IRC servers, all users by default have server side ignore set. This means that only people on your accept list are able to private message you. You can remove this setting from your session by removing mode g. Alternatively you can remove mode g and set mode G to automatically accept messages from users you share a channel with.

item.title: Rules & Notes

item.title: How to debate on IRC
item.description: Why a HowTo on debating on IRC As with any medium IRC has its own character and properties that influence the way conversations flow and are conducted. This makes a specific way of signalling important, since on IRC nobody can see your facial expressions or gestures. This often leads to confusing and chaotic posting that does not help any conversation. For this reason, there are a few simple rules and signals that can improve IRC communication for everybody, making it more profitable and fun.
